duties_responsibilities.duty: Analyze, develop and administer employee health, welfare, and retirement plans for U.S. and Canadian populations.
Act as a liaison between benefits broker, insurance providers, and third parties to resolve benefit-related problems.
Ensure plans are administered in accordance with federal and state regulations and plan provisions are followed.
Assist in M&A due diligence processes by conducting benefit analysis of target companies.
Configure benefits module of ADP Vantage for ongoing enrollment and maintain eligibility file feeds sent to vendors.
Ensure all annual filings and notices are completed accurately and on time (1095’s, 5500’s, etc.).
Administer health and welfare plans including enrollments and terminations.
Administer the 401(k) plan and lead the annual 401(k) audit in coordination with auditor, TPA, and accounting teams.
Analyze competitiveness of plans and recommend new enhancements or changes to maintain market competitiveness.
Lead the annual open enrollment period each year.
Generate and distribute benefit awareness program materials on a monthly basis to U.S. and Canadian employees.
Partner with HR, Legal, HRIS, Finance, Treasury, and executive management on benefits matters.
Carry out other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business or related discipline, or equivalent experience required
Professional in Human Resources (PHR), or SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-CP) credential preferred
Certified Benefits Professional (CBP) or Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) preferred
